column6: went on the journey to meet her lord and savior on sunday
column10: she was the daughter of the late clifford clayton and florence (frishkorn) dambaugh. leona was a1957 graduate of evans city high school. she was a faithful member of the park presbyterian church
column11: where she served as a deacon and belonged to the martha circle. she worked for 23 years as a housekeeper at passavant retirement community. leona had a magnificent smile that lit up the room. she enjoyed gardening in the summer and
column13: spending time with her pride and joy
column15: braeden. the family would like to extend a special thank you to the cranberry care center staff and the doctors and nurses of the upmc passavant hospital. she leaves behind to cherish her memory her loving husband of 48 years
column16: douglas marburger of harmony; her three loving children
column19: and eric marburger or harmony; her brother
column24: braeden marburger. in addition to her parents
column25: leona was preceded in death by two brother and two sisters. the marburger family will welcome friends from 2-4 & 7-9 p. m. on wednesday
column30: zelienople. a funeral ceremony will be celebrated 11:00 a. m. on thursday
column34: officiating. she will be laid to rest at butler county memorial park. memorial donations may be made in leona's honor to the park presbyterian church
column37: pa 16063 or the american cancer society
